Simple, come up with your own arbitrary rules for this game. The only rule is that all rules must be completely arbitrary. You don't have to follow any rules but that one, cuz the rest are just arbitrary.

Rule #1: All rules must be numbered!

Next rule: No typing faster than 30 words per minute! Show offs.

Arbitrary rules must rank higher than 5 on a scale of 1-10 of arbitrariness.

No scoring the previous posts' arbitrariness. Arbitrariness is completely subjective.
Are these rules cumulative and have to be followed in subsequent posts? If so, the first rule should be that if two rules contradict each other, the second rule should be ignored.

Extra points are given the more contradictory your arbitrary rules are.

Points are subtracted if you actually try to follow any of the arbitrary rules.

This is a game where the rules are ignored and the points don't matter.

Giving anyone points for their rules or taking points away from people for accidentally following the rules is against the rules.

 

FYI: You just got 10 points for not posting any rules...which is against the rules. You MUST come up with an arbitrary rule. If you believe your rule should be a rule than you must state it with authority that it is indeed the rule.

I'll add a rule: 

No two consecutive rules may begin with the same word.
A new rule must be posted every day, if not every hour
Only one rule may be posted each day.

Rules are against the rules, unless, of course, its the rule that bans rules. 

Edited July 7, 2016 by PB666

Points are removed whenever anyone seems to "get" the rules of the game.

At no point shall any of the rules make any sense what-so-ever, but they must be easy to understand but NOT to easy to comprehend.

All rules must be fractured but whole. (hehehehe)

 

Edit: New rule, no giggling! But you may slightly chuckle.

GOLLY THIS SEEMS LIKE A FUN GAME. LET ME TRY.

Rule: All rules must contain an emoticon if the moon is waxing, a bold word if it is full, an italic if it is waning, and an underline if it is new. A rule can contain all of those only if the person who typed it was holding between one and fifty grams of chocolate at the time of writing it.
